summary: The Navy uses operational testing to assess the capabilities of new ships. But "fleet organizations" that work in ship operations aren't consistently represented in test planning. This misses opportunities to get direct user feedback to make tests more relevant. Using more digital tools could improve testing, too. For example, digital twins can allow the Navy to find and address some issues before live testing—saving money...
title: Navy Shipbuilding: Improving Warfighter Engagement and Tools for Operational Testing Could Increase Timeliness and Usefulness
